result.execSummary:
The defendant Lafayette B Lugo was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Waukesha County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Straight Time.
Apply 2 days sentence credit, if revoked.
Court will allow for transfer to Milwaukee County.

miscConds.notes:
Court costs and DNA surcharge are to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.
AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.

ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Submit to random urine screens.
No use or possession of alcohol, illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of any and all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged and distributed.
No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (for example, bars, taverns or liquor stores).
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
No contact with JC Penney or with the co-actors listed in the Criminal Complaint.

timeConds.notes:
Non-working hours (Huber) with all standard release conditions.
STAYED - to be used at Agent's discretion.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Lafayette B Lugo

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Notice of Case Status Change - Revoked - Sentenced to Jail/HOC
  Wis. Dept. of Corrections notice of case status change received.  Outstanding financial obligations have been converted to a civil judgment.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Lafayette B Lugo in court with attorney Clarice Rosa Perkins.  

Defendant enters a plea of Guilty to the charge.
Court finds the defendant Guilty of the charge.


Court orders the following:
125 Days in the Waukesha County Jail - Straight-Time.
2 Days Credit - IF REVOKED.
STAYED.

Term of Probation:  12 Months.
Court will allow for transfer to MIlwaukee County.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
No Use or Possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
No contact with:  JCPenney or co-actors listed in the criminal complaint.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.
No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (i.e bars, taverns, or liquor stores).

Costs:  $243
DNA Sample (Court Waives the Sample ONLY) and Surcharge:  $200
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
To be paid as a Condition of Probation.

CONDITION TIME: 
30 Days in the Waukesha County Jail w/huber (all standard release conditions).
STAYED - To be used at agent's discretion.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 03-21-2016 01:30 pm

Bryan C. Bayer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Lafayette B Lugo in court with attorney Clarice Rosa Perkins.  
Defense still in negotiations with the State.

  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for March 21, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Motion to forfeit bail granted.
Atty. Perkins appointed to represent the defendant.
Hearing at 02-17-2016 01:30 pm

Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.   Defendant to have no contact with co defendant or JC Penney Store listed in the Criminal Complaint.

Defendant Lafayette B Lugo in court, in custody, with attorney Amber K. Rumpf.   Susan L. Opper appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for February 17, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Waukesha County Pretrial Screening Services Report by Wisconsin Community Services filed.
Signature bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of 750.00.
For Non-Appearance.

Timothy Suha appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Lafayette B Lugo not in court.  
Case scheduled for 2:00 pm. and Matter called @ 2:35 pm.

Court orders a warrant be issued.
Bail is revoked and forfeited.
Cash Bail Set @ $750.
Hearing at 12-15-2015 02:00 pm

District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Natalie Schiferl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Lafayette B Lugo not in court.   
Case scheduled for 3 pm and Matter called @ 3:46 pm.

Court orders a stayed warrant to the next court date.
MANDATORY APPEARANCE BY THE DEFENDANT IS REQUIRED OR A WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED.
  Hearing scheduled for December 15, 2015 at 02:00 pm.
Hearing at 11-30-2015 03:00 pm

Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant to have no contact with JCPenny store or alleged co defendants listed in the Criminal Complaint.

Defendant Lafayette B Lugo in court.  Kristi J Gordon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  Defendant to apply at Public Defender's Office for representation.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.
  Hearing scheduled for November 30, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
